value.title: Migrate on-premises PostgreSQL databases to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
value.excerpt: Migrate on-premises PostgreSQL to Azure Database for PostgreSQL

value.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances
value.excerpt: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances

value.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases
value.excerpt: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases

value.title: Model and partition your data in Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Learn how to identify access patterns. Using those patterns then you can learn to apply modeling and partition strategies to ensure an efficient and scalable deployment of your Azure Cosmos DB instance.

value.title: Optimize the performance of Azure Cosmos DB by using partitioning and indexing strategies
value.excerpt: Learn how to measure the performance of your NoSQL Azure Cosmos DB database, by monitoring, partitioning, and indexing

value.title: Persist and retrieve relational data with Entity Framework Core
value.excerpt: This module guides you through creating a data access project, connecting to a relational database, and writing CRUD queries.

value.title: Protect data in-transit and at rest
value.excerpt: Protect data in-transit and at rest

value.title: Protecting, monitoring and tuning a migrated database
value.excerpt: Protecting, monitoring, and tuning a migrated database

value.title: Query Azure Cosmos DB with Apache Spark for Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Query Azure Cosmos DB with Apache Spark for Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Query Azure Cosmos DB with SQL Serverless for Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Query Azure Cosmos DB with SQL Serverless for Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Introduction to securing data at rest on Azure
value.excerpt: Identify the data in your organization and store it on Azure. Store secrets securely, and use client-side encryption and Storage Service Encryption to help protect your data.

value.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
value.excerpt: Find out about creating an application with Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database, then retrieve, manipulate, and visualize graph data using Data Explorer.

value.title: Store and Access NoSQL Data with Azure Cosmos DB and the Table API
value.excerpt: By using the Azure Cosmos DB Table API, you will benefit from the low latency, high availability, and scalability of Azure Cosmos DB in a Table storage application.

value.title: 5 Things you didn't know about Azure SQL Database | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn about 5 things you didn't know about Azure SQL Database.   For more tips and tricks, visit: https://aka.ms/azuretipsandtricks   Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft Azure: https://azure.com/free

value.title: An intro to Azure Cosmos DB JavaScript SDK 2.0 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Chris Anderson joins Donovan Brown to discuss Azure Cosmos DB JavaScript SDK 2.0, which adds support for multi-region writes, a new fluent-style object model—making it easier to reference Azure Cosmos DB resources without an explicit URL—and support for promises and other modern JavaScript features.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/UkXsosjbWKA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: An intro to Azure Cosmos DB .NET SDK 3.0 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk joins Scott Hanselman to discuss new improvements for Azure Cosmos DB SDKs, including the new, idiomatic .NET SDK with friendlier, more intuitive programming model, better testability, better performance, .NET Standard 2.0 support, and now open sourced. value.title: Azure Cosmos DB Free Tier and Autopilot | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk joins Scott Hanselman to go over two important updates to Azure Cosmos DB: Free Tier and Autopilot. value.title: Azure Cosmos DB update for August 2019 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure Cosmos DB keeps getting better with a preview of notebook support, we've got Apache Spark, great new optimizations in queries, and idiomatic SDKs now on v3. value.title: Azure Cosmos DB update: MongoDB 4.0, notebooks, and continuous backup | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk joins Scott Hanselman to provide another Azure Cosmos DB update with several members of the Azure Cosmos DB engineering team.  0:00 – Introduction 2:20 – MongoDB 4.0 (Gahl Levy) 12:30 – Azure Cosmos DB notebooks (Tanuj Mittal) 22:43 – Continuous backups (Govind Kanshi) 31:25 – Wrap-up

value.title: Azure Friday | Apache Spark Connector for Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Emily Lawton stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman about the Azure Cosmos DB Spark Connector, which enables Azure Cosmos DB to act as an input source or output sink for Apache Spark jobs.  For more information, see:  Azure Cosmos DB Spark Wiki - https://github.com/azure/azure-cosmosdb-spark/wiki

value.excerpt: Azure Cosmos DB is a globally distributed database with limitless elastic scale. To take advantage of elastic scale, you first need to choose a partition key. value.title: Azure Friday | Azure SQL Data Warehouse compute optimized performance tier
value.excerpt: Ron Ortloff talks with Scott Hanselman about the new Azure SQL Data Warehouse compute optimized tier that enables you to analyze ever growing amounts of data more easily, and how the team used NVM Express caching for up to 100x better performance. value.excerpt: Veljko Vasic shows Seth Juarez how Azure SQL Database uses built-in intelligence to continuously monitors database usage so that it can detect disruptive events that cause poor performance. value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk shows Scott Hanselman an easy way to build planet-scale serverless apps in minutes using Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions. value.title: Azure Friday | Try Azure Cosmos DB for Free
value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk shows Scott Hanselman a new way to try Azure Cosmos DB free of charge, no sign-up or credit card required. It's a perfect way to get to know Azure Cosmos DB better, without commitment. For more information, see: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/try/cosmosdb/
